material.mattext: State the test statistic, interpret its value and show how it was found.

Here is the R output:
> t.test(drinks$drinks.per.week,mu = 4.73, alternative = "two.sided")
One Sample t-test
data: drinks$drinks.per.week t = -1.8275, df = 74, p-value = 0.07165 alternative hypothesis: true mean is not equal to 4.73 95 percent confidence interval: 3.064735 4.801932 sample estimates: mean of x 3.933333
The test statistic, t = -1.83, is calculated as follows:
The sample mean is 1.83 standard errors below the null value.
